an10.67:4.1: At one time the Buddha was wandering in the land of the Kosalans together with a large Saṅgha of mendicants when he arrived at a town of the Kosalans named Naḷakapāna.
an10.67:4.2: There the Buddha stayed near Naḷakapāna in the parrot tree grove.
an10.67:4.3: Now, at that time it was the sabbath, and the Buddha was sitting surrounded by the Saṅgha of monks.
an10.67:4.4: The Buddha spent most of the night educating, encouraging, firing up, and inspiring the mendicants with a Dharma talk. Then he looked around the Saṅgha of monks, who were so very silent. He addressed Venerable Sāriputta:
an10.67:5.1: “Sāriputta, the Saṅgha of mendicants is rid of dullness and drowsiness.
an10.67:5.2: Give them some Dharma talk as you feel inspired.
an10.67:6.1: And then the Buddha spread out his outer robe folded in four and lay down in the lion’s posture—on the right side, placing one foot on top of the other—mindful and aware, and focused on the time of getting up.
an10.67:7.1: “Reverends, whoever has no faith, conscience, prudence, energy, and wisdom when it comes to wholesome qualities
an10.67:7.4: can expect decline, not growth, in wholesome qualities, whether by day or by night.
an10.67:7.5: It’s like the moon in the waning fortnight. Whether by day or by night, its beauty, roundness, light, and diameter and circumference only decline.
an10.67:7.6: In the same way, whoever has no faith, conscience, prudence, energy, and wisdom when it comes to wholesome qualities
an10.67:7.9: can expect decline, not growth, in wholesome qualities, whether by day or by night.
an10.67:8.1: A faithless individual is in decline.
an10.67:8.2: An individual with no conscience is in decline.
an10.67:8.3: An imprudent individual is in decline.
an10.67:8.4: A lazy individual is in decline.
an10.67:8.5: A witless individual is in decline.
an10.67:8.6: An angry individual is in decline.
an10.67:8.7: A hostile individual is in decline.
an10.67:8.8: An individual with bad desires is in decline.
an10.67:8.9: An individual with bad friends is in decline.
an10.67:8.10: An individual with wrong view is in decline.
an10.67:9.1: Whoever has faith, conscience, prudence, energy, and wisdom when it comes to wholesome qualities
an10.67:9.3: can expect growth, not decline, in wholesome qualities, whether by day or by night.
an10.67:9.4: It’s like the moon in the waxing fortnight. Whether by day or by night, its beauty, roundness, light, and diameter and circumference only grow.
an10.67:9.5: In the same way, whoever has faith, conscience, prudence, energy, and wisdom when it comes to wholesome qualities
an10.67:9.8: can expect growth, not decline, in wholesome qualities, whether by day or by night.
an10.67:10.2: An individual with a conscience doesn’t decline.
an10.67:10.8: An individual with few desires doesn’t decline.
an10.67:10.9: An individual with good friends doesn’t decline.
an10.67:10.10: An individual with right view doesn’t decline.

an10.67:12.10: An individual with wrong view is in decline.
